page.title: 16BURRINGTON CUSTOMS
page.content: {BURRINGTON FAIR.} On Fair Day morning, the{Vicar}stands {by the oak tree}in the square to take donations to the church. The Church Sale is held that afternoon in the Parish Hall. {CHURCH SHEEP.} {About 20 ewes}are bought in the autumn by the churchwarden on behalf of the church, and are farmed out in couples. They lamb in spring and the ewes and lambs are sold{on Fair Day.}The money goes to church funds. {CAROL SINGING Every year people from the village go{carol singing}the week before Christmas. They visit every house in the village area. Then another night they travel in cars to outlying areas. They collect for a different charity each year.
